title: ErrorResponse
description: The error details that an API returns in the response body whenever the API request isn’t successful.

errors.description: An array of one or more errors.

ErrorResponse.Errors.title: ErrorResponse.Errors
ErrorResponse.Errors.description: The details about an error that returns when an API request isn’t successful.

id.description: The unique ID of a specific instance of an error, request, and response. Use this ID when providing feedback to, or debugging issues with, Apple.

title.description: A summary of the error. Don’t use this field for programmatic error handling.

code.description: A machine-readable code indicating the type of error. The code is a hierarchical value with levels of specificity separated by a period (.). This value is parseable for programmatic error handling in code.

detail.description: A detailed explanation of the error. Don’t use this field for programmatic error handling.

source.description: One of two possible types of values — source.Parameter when a query parameter produces the error, or source.JsonPointer when a problem with the entity produces the error.

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error. This status code usually matches the response’s status code. However, if the request produces multiple errors, these two codes may differ.
